. This was a brilliant stroke, but no follow-on troops were allocated to occupy those bypassed areas-and thus to preempt the insurgency that grew up as a result. "In retrospect," Donald Rumsfeld allows, it's possible there may have been times when more troops could have been helpful.... It is conceivable that several thousand more troops in Baghdad, where most of the media was located, might have at least kept the capital from appearing so chaotic, a perception that proved damaging throughout our country and the world( p. 664, italics added). Eric Schmidt said never in his wildest dreams did he expect Google to be this successful when he joined 10 years ago. He said that himself, Page and Sergey Brin had acted as a triumvirate over the past decade with all been equally involved in making decisions. He said this policy would continue but change was needed. "We have also agreed to clarify our individual roles so there's clear responsibility and accountability at the top of the company."
